column4: hello everyone.  I got madwifi installed ok, and modprobed it, but I don't see my device, as the tutorial says I should.  Does anyone know what could be wrong?
what wifi card are you using?
It uses the net5416 driver, the model name I'm not sure of.  But I got to the point where I was able to at least see the card in iwconfig before I reinstalled Ubuntu, so I'm sure it's supported.
from a terminal execute: sudo lspci -nnv > ~/adamlspci and paste it on postbin
then post the url of your pastebin page here and i'll (we'll) have a look
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/46638/
The wireless card is on line 129

Try this: http://ubuntu-tutorials.com/2007/03/18/how-to-configure-wireless-on-a-macbook-using-ndiswrapper/ ... Note: you need the latest version of ndiswrapper to get then functioning properly (i did too), so remove if it's currently installed, grab the source, and compile...
I got ndsiwrapper working, and I'd prefer to use it, but there's no 64-bit XP driver for my card...
So, it wasn't actually _working_, of course...  But it would have if I had a 64-bit drvier 8)
yes, 64-bit seems to be an issue... let me check a couple of things... brb
Alright, thank you :)  i'll be here!

madwifi. The stable tree of that driver does not support this recent chipset yet (as of 2007/04/18), but there is a beta branch with a more recent hal with basic support. However, only unencrypted connections work at the moment with that branch, WPA is still broken. (page: http://en.opensuse.org/MacBook_Pro_Specials#Networking_.2F_WLAN )
Do you know what it means when it says "AR5008 support is available in trunk"?
'trunk' is the current development trunk, still beta software
think of a tree and branches the finished one is grafted into the stable release and the other tree is still growing, not yet ready for grafting into the stable release.

Ahh.  Dang, I'm thinking I should just isntall the 32-bit version and use ndiswrapper. :/  But I had a problem in 32-bit version, I was unable to get ndiswrapper as far installed as I have it now, on the 64-bit install.  Something about ndiswrapper.ko missing.  :( Hmmm...
Hehheh, I get it 8)
that's what MANY people have had to do for their own sanity...
I'm goin' on a few days, that's for sure.  Sigh.  Oh well, I think I've decided to do a 32-bit install.  Shucks...  i guess it's an _investment_ in sanity, ya gotta spend some to make some :)
so true, keep looking for the madwifi to go stable and then maybe try again...
My thoughts exactly
Well, thank you for your help!  I appreciate it :)
hopefully, that's what everyone's here for... good luck
